originalText.text: So infatuated with The Vessel! Totally hate, I never made it to the top prior to its closure. I love this area in general. The following photos are a month old, but still worth sharing.

text.text: So infatuated with The Vessel! Totally hate, I never made it to the top prior to its closure. I love this area in general. The following photos are a month old, but still worth sharing.

originalText.text: Backyard at Hudson Yards is one of those places that doesn't seem to know what it wants to be. It doesn't know if it is supposed to be an architectural art exhibit, a tourist attraction, or a passive park. Instead, what you have is an artistic multilevel structure as the center piece that while a visually attractive marvel, serves no purpose other than to be a tourist attraction lookout with a very limited view point because of all the taller buildings that bracket it, a small greenway with a walk and benches, a dollop of sun chairs, and a few food stands. It's nice, but it's just comes across as an incomprehensible mish mash of things thrown together in hopes of cohesion, but ends up as a plaster dash.

originalText.text:
I discovered a great spot near the Vessel in New York. It has a huge screen where they show live sports events, not just soccer but also other major games. It's a comfortable place to take a break and enjoy the games while visiting the Highline.

Additionally, I found out they screen classic movies, like romcoms and timeless classics. They have a schedule, mostly in the evenings around 6 or 7 PM. Keep in mind the weather, as it can get cold, so it's best to visit during the warmer months. It's a fantastic and free option for visitors from around the world, providing both sports and film entertainment.

originalText.text: Love this set up. After walking from 14th Street a deck chair in the sun was most welcome. Watched the US Open on the big screen. On the backside of the “pine one” which is very unfortunately closed for good… I hope they find someway to open it in the future…and prevent people from jumping of it.

originalText.text: I love this place so bad. easy to go there and always do the events. Unfortunately, after the accident, it is no longer possible to climb to the top, but you can still go inside.
